page.title: 03The Miner's Strike 1984/85
page.content: In February we put our house up for sale. But in March the Miner's Strike began. We would never sell our house now and my dad was on picket duty. I didn't get new toys and my parents missed out too. My dad was rarely home and when he came he went to bed because he was extremely tired. When Christmas came I was not expecting much but I got a Â£130 BMX bicycle. When my birthday arrived I got new clothes, a computer game and money. My dad used to tell me stories about how the police nearly caught him on the picket lines but he always got away. February '85 came and went without incident and then came the anniversary in March. The Unions were desperately trying to get a settlement.The end of the strike enabled us to lead a normal life again.
